intro: Tithymalus pinkavanus, commonly known as the pinkavanus tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence composed of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to other members of its family. Tithymalus pinkavanus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
